Although both catalysts are based on 2-fold interpenetrated structures, upon treatment with Ti(OPr-i)4, one catalyzes the addn. of diethylzinc to arom. aldehydes with high enantioselectivity (up to 90% ee), while the other is inactive.

        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        57
        Cp*Rh-Based Heterometallic Metallarectangles: Size-Dependent Borromean Link Structures and Catalytic Acyl Transfer
        Huang, Sheng-Li; Lin, Yue-Jian; Hor, T. S. Andy; Jin, Guo-Xin
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2013), 135 (22), 8125-8128CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Cp*Rh-based functional metallarectangles were synthesized from metallaligands, e.g., [Cu(opba)]2- [opba = o-phenylenebis(oxamato)]. Enlargement of one linker gives two novel Borromean link architectures. All these complexes are intact in soln., as evident from ESI-MS spectroscopic anal. Arising from the combination of open Cu centers and favorable cavity space, {(Cp*Rh)4(bpe)2[Cu(opba)·2MeOH]2}4(OTf)·6MeOH shows extraordinary catalytic abilities with high efficiency and wide substrate selectivity in the acyl-transfer reaction.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXnvVCqsbw%253D&md5=9bc1fde07131344c764bfd121fe58c5e
      58. 58
        Schoedel, A.; Boyette, W.; Wojtas, L.; Eddaoudi, M.; Zaworotko, M.-J. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2013, 135, 14016– 14019
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        58
        A Family of Porous Lonsdaleite-e Networks Obtained through Pillaring of Decorated Kagome Lattice Sheets
        Schoedel, Alexander; Boyette, Wesley; Wojtas, Lukasz; Eddaoudi, Mohamed; Zaworotko, Michael J.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2013), 135 (38), 14016-14019CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A new and versatile class of metal-org. materials (MOMs) with augmented lonsdaleite-e (lon-e-a) topol. is presented herein. The authors report the synthesis, crystal structure, and gas sorption properties of [Zn6(5-R-bdc)6[Cr3O(isonic)6(H2O)2(OH)]]·y solv (R = H, Me, tBu, NO2, NH2, OH, OMe, Br; solv = DMF, MeOH) and [Zn6[2,5-fdc]6[Cr3O(isonicotinate)6(DMF)3]X]·y solv (X = NO3-, OH-) based upon 5-substituted-1,3-benzenedicarboxylate or 2,5-furandicarboxylate. This family of lon-e nets are built by pillaring of hexagonal two-dimensional kagome (kag) lattices constructed from known [Zn2(CO2R)4] paddlewheel mol. building blocks (MBBs) connected by 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate (bdc2-) linkers. The pillars are [Cr3(μ3-O)-(RCO2)]6 trigonal prismatic primary MBBs decorated by six pyridyl moieties (tp-PMBB-1). The 3-fold symmetry (D3h) of tp-PMBB-1 is complementary with the alternating orientation of the axial sites of the paddlewheel MBBs and enables triple crosslinking of the kag layers by each pillar. These MOMs represent the 1st examples of axial-to-axial pillared undulating kag layers, and they are readily fine-tuned because the bdc2- moieties can be varied at their 5-position without changing the overall structure. This lon-e platform possesses functionalized hexagonal channels since the kag lattices are necessarily eclipsed. The effects of the substituent at the 5-positions of the bdc2- linkers upon gas adsorption, particularly the heats of adsorption of CO2 and methane, were studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhsVWjs7jE&md5=9d944b60a6a1975d3bccad9cd1952f59
      59. 59
        James, S.-L. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2003, 32, 276– 288
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        59
        Metal-organic frameworks
        James, Stuart L.
        Chemical Society Reviews (2003), 32 (5), 276-288CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review. Metal-org. frameworks are a recently-identified class of porous polymeric material, consisting of metal ions linked together by org. bridging ligands, and are a new development on the interface between mol. coordination chem. and materials science. A range of novel structures was prepd. which feature amongst the largest pores known for cryst. compds., very high sorption capacities and complex sorption behavior not seen in aluminosilicate zeolites. The development of synthetic approaches to these materials and studies of their properties are reviewed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXmtFOltLY%253D&md5=e9e83de0580c0b7dc9929ea3594efe12

        Shi, D.-B.; Ren, Y.-W.; Jiang, H.-F.; Cai, B.-W.; Lu, J.-X. Inorg. Chem. 2012, 51, 6498– 6506
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        60
        Synthesis, Structures, and Properties of Two Three-Dimensional Metal-Organic Frameworks, Based on Concurrent Ligand Extension
        Shi, Dabin; Ren, Yanwei; Jiang, Huanfeng; Cai, Bowei; Lu, Jiaxian
        Inorganic Chemistry (2012), 51 (12), 6498-6506CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        A tritopic carboxylate ligand, tris(4'-carboxybiphenyl)amine (L-H3), was synthesized and applied in the construction of microporous metal-org. frameworks (MOFs). Two novel metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), {[Zn2(L)(OH)]·2DMF·H2O}∞ (1) and {[Cu(L-H)(DMA)]·DMA·2H2O}∞ (2), were constructed out of L-H3, Zn2+, and Cu2+, resp. 1 Has a 2-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional framework formed by L connectors and the [Zn2(CO2)3] secondary building units (SBUs). For 1, one μ2-OH group links two Zn atoms between two neighboring SBUs to produce interesting Zn-O-Zn zigzag chains in the structure. 2 Has a two-dimensional grid sheet formed by L-H connectors and the typical paddle-wheel [Cu2(CO2)4] SBUs. Two-dimensional (2D) sheets nest with each other, which finally forms a three-dimensional (3D) nested framework. Two MOFs were characterized by IR spectroscopy, TG, single-crystal and elemental analyses, and powder x-ray diffraction methods. Framework 1' exhibits high permanent porosity (Langmuir surface area = 848 m2/g), high thermal stability (up to 450°), highly active properties for Friedel-Crafts alkylation reaction, as well as the potential application for the CO2 gas storage and luminescent material. The catalytic results reveal that 2' is indeed an efficient heterogeneous catalyst for olefin epoxidn. reactions.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XotFGlsb4%253D&md5=25129e4ae847549d923446d77a01e6fd

        Ferey, G. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2008, 37, 191– 214
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        61
        Hybrid porous solids: past, present, future
        Ferey, Gerard
        Chemical Society Reviews (2008), 37 (1), 191-214CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review. This crit. review will be of interest to the experts in porous solids (including catalysis), but also solid state chemists and physicists. It presents the state-of-the-art on hybrid porous solids, their advantages, their new routes of synthesis, the structural concepts useful for their 'design', aiming at reaching very large pores. Their dynamic properties and the possibility of predicting their structure are described. The large tunability of the pore size leads to unprecedented properties and applications. They concern adsorption of species, storage and delivery and the phys. properties of the dense phases. (323 refs.).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXmtVWgsg%253D%253D&md5=89265036ce82503c95ce56685a9ceceb

        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar

        Magnetic and luminescence properties of Cu(II), Cu(II)4O4 core, and Cd(II) mixed-ligand metal-organic frameworks constructed from 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane and benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate
        Habib, Hesham A.; Sanchiz, Joaquin; Janiak, Christoph
        Inorganica Chimica Acta (2009), 362 (7), 2452-2460CODEN: ICHAA3; ISSN:0020-1693. (Elsevier B.V.)
        The hydrothermal reaction of Cu(NO3)2·3H2O, Cu(ClO4)2·6H2O, or CdSO4·8/3H2O with benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) produced the mixed-ligand coordination polymers and networks (MOFs) 1∞{[Cu(H2btc)2(μ-btre)]} (1), 3∞{[Cu4(μ5-btc)2(μ3-OH)2(μ4-btre)]·2H2O} (2), and 3∞{[Cd3(μ6-btc)2(μ4-btre)]·H2O} (3). The centrosym. tetranuclear, chair-shaped or stepped-cubane Cu4O4 metal building unit in 2 has three different Cu contacts, each involving more than one bridging group. A quasi-butterfly magnetostructural model shows dominant antiferromagnetic interactions in this Cu4 unit with three different magnetic exchange pathways with 2J1 = 258, 2J2 = -416, and 2J3 = 484 cm-1 from the magnetic susceptibility measurement between 1.9 and 300 K. For this Cu4O4 unit the Eigenvalues assocd. with the zero field spin Hamiltonian were calcd. by solving the 16 × 16 matrix to obtain the numerical expression for the magnetic susceptibility. The Cd-btre framework 3, with bridged Cd strands, shows a strong bluish fluorescence at 421 nm upon excitation at 317 nm (not seen in the free btre ligand).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXltVymur0%253D&md5=7b4e73ee8c6c6256d2a024323285395c
      63. 63
        Elsaidi, S.-K.; Mohamed, M.-H.; Wojtas, L.; Chanthapally, A.; Pham, T.; Space, B.; Vittal, J.-J.; Zaworotko, M.-J. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2014, 136, 5072– 5077
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        63
        Putting the Squeeze on CH4 and CO2 through Control over Interpenetration in Diamondoid Nets
        Elsaidi, Sameh K.; Mohamed, Mona H.; Wojtas, Lukasz; Chanthapally, Anjana; Pham, Tony; Space, Brian; Vittal, Jagadese J.; Zaworotko, Michael J.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2014), 136 (13), 5072-5077CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        The authors report the synthesis, structure, and sorption properties of a family of eight diamondoid (dia) metal-org. materials (MOMs) that are sustained by Co(II) or Zn(II) cations linked by one of three rigid ligands: 4-(2-(4-pyridyl)ethenyl)benzoate (1), 4-(pyridin-4-yl)benzoate (2), and 4-(pyridin-4-yl)acrylate (3). Pore size control in this family of dia nets was exerted by two approaches: changing the length of the linker ligand from 1 to 3, and using solvent as a template to control the level of interpenetration in nets based upon 1 and 3. The resulting MOMs, dia-8i-1, dia-5i-3, dia-7i-1-Zn, dia-7i-1-Co, dia-4i-3-a, dia-4i-3-b, dia-4i-2, and dia-4i-1, exhibit 1-dimensional channels with pore limiting diams. (PLDs) of 1.64, 2.90, 5.06, 5.28, 8.57, 8.83, 11.86, and 18.25 Å, resp. The authors selected dia nets for this study for the following reasons: their 1-dimensional channels facilitate study of the impact of pore size on gas sorption parameters in situations where pore chem. is similar (pyridyl benzoate-type linkers) or identical (in the case of polymorphs), and their satd. metal centers eliminate open metal sites from dominating sorbent-solvate interactions and possibly masking the effect of pore size. The authors' data reveal that smaller pore sizes offer stronger interactions, as detd. by the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) and the steepness of the adsorption isotherm in the low-pressure region. The porous MOM with the smallest PLD suitable for physisorption, dia-7i-1-Co, was thereby found to exhibit the highest Qst values for CO2 and CH4. Indeed, dia-7i-1-Co exhibits a Qst for CH4 of 26.7 kJ/mol, which was validated through grand canonical Monte Carlo simulation studies of CH4 adsorption. This Qst value is considerably higher than those found in covalent org. frameworks and other MOMs with unsatd. metal centers. These results therefore further validate the crit. role that PLD plays in gas adsorption by porous MOMs.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2cXjvVOnsrc%253D&md5=af511913d531724c0ec51c19c82cb75a

        Lanthanide Metal-Organic Frameworks: Searching for Efficient Solvent-Free Catalysts
        D'Vries, Richard F.; Iglesias, Marta; Snejko, Natalia; Gutierrez-Puebla, Enrique; Monge, M. Angeles
        Inorganic Chemistry (2012), 51 (21), 11349-11355CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Three Ln-based 2-dimensional metal-org. frameworks [Ln(3,5-DSB)(Phen)] (Ln = La, Pr, Nd; 3,5-DSB = 3,5-disulfobenzoate; Phen = 1,10-phenanthroline) were hydrothermally synthesized. They belong to two 2-dimensional structural types, and their nets own different topologies. The isostructural La and Pr compds. possess a uninodal 5-connected SP 2-periodic net (6,3). The Nd compd. has a binodal 3- and 6-connected kgd net. The novel compds. exhibit excellent catalytic activities toward the cyanosilylation reaction under solvent-free conditions.

        Better understanding of mechanochemical reactions: Raman monitoring reveals surprisingly simple 'pseudo-fluid' model for a ball milling reaction
        Ma, Xiaohe; Yuan, Wenbing; Bell, Steven E. J.; James, Stuart L.
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2014), 50 (13), 1585-1587CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Quant. monitoring of a mechanochem. reaction by Raman spectroscopy leads to a surprisingly straightforward second-order kinetic model in which the rate is detd. simply by the frequency of reactive collisions between reactant particles.

        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar

        Efficient, Scalable, and Solvent-free Mechanochemical Synthesis of the OLED Material Alq3 (q = 8-Hydroxyquinolinate)
        Ma, Xiaohe; Lim, Gin Keat; Harris, Kenneth D. M.; Apperley, David C.; Horton, Peter N.; Hursthouse, Michael B.; James, Stuart L.
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (12), 5869-5872CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        The Al complex Alq3 (q = 8-hydroxyquinolinate), which has important applications in org. light-emitting diode materials, is readily synthesized as a pure phase under solvent-free mechanochem. conditions from Al(OAc)2OH and 8-hydroxyquinoline by ball milling. The initial product of the mechanochem. synthesis is a novel HOAc solvate of Alq3, and the α polymorph of Alq3 is obtained on subsequent heating/desolvation of this phase. The structure of the mechanochem. prepd. HOAc solvate of Alq3 was detd. directly from powder x-ray diffraction data and is a different polymorph from the corresponding HOAc solvate prepd. by soln.-state crystn. of Alq3 from HOAc. Significantly, the mechanochem. synthesis of Alq3 is fully scalable across 2 orders of magnitude from 0.5 to 50 g scale. The Alq3 sample obtained from the solvent-free mechanochem. synthesis is anal. pure and exhibits identical photoluminescence behavior to that of a sample prepd. by the conventional synthetic route.

        Mononuclear, oligonuclear and polynuclear metal coordination compounds with 1,2,4-triazole derivatives as ligands
        Haasnoot, J. G.
        Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2000), 200-202 (), 131-185CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier Science S.A.)
        A review with 275 refs. on transition metal complexes of 1,2,4-Triazole and its derivs. details their ability to unite the coordination geometry of both pyrazoles and imidazoles, and in addn. exhibit a strong and typical property of acting as bridging ligands between two metal centers. In this bridging capacity, the 1,2,4-triazole ligands show a great coordination diversity, esp. when the triazole nucleus is substituted with addnl. donor groups. This property together with their strong σ donor properties and the relative ease of synthesis make them very appealing for the design of new polynuclear metal complexes with interesting properties. A no. of x-ray structures were evaluated in some detail.

        1,10-Phenanthroline: a versatile ligand
        Sammes, Peter G.; Yahioglu, Gokhan
        Chemical Society Reviews (1994), 23 (5), 327-34CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review with 36 refs. Over the past decade the classical chelator, 1,10-phenanthroline, has been catapulted into a starring role in the field of supramol. chem. and mol. recognition. This review aims to illustrate the use of 1,10-phenantholine and its derivs. in areas such as the chiral recognition of DNA, as a probe for left-handed and right-handed forms; in DNA nicking reagents; as enzyme mimetics, promoting redox reactions; and as a sensitizer of europium in com. heterogeneous immuno- and DNA assays, utilizing time-resolved luminescence. An approach to the development of a homogeneous DNA assay using derivs. of this ligand is also described.

        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        70
        Bridging ligands comprising two or more di-2-pyridylmethyl or amine arms: Alternatives to 2,2'-bipyridyl-containing bridging ligands
        Sumby, Christopher J.
        Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2011), 255 (15-16), 1937-1967CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier B.V.)
        A review. Bridging ligands incorporating 2,2'-bipyridine as a chelating component were used for several decades and are widely employed in coordination chem., supramol. chem. and materials synthesis. Such ligands form stable 5-membered chelate rings upon coordination to a metal. Two related chelating units, di-2-pyridylamine and di-2-pyridylmethane, which form 6-membered chelate rings when coordinated to a metal, were studied far less as components of bridging ligands but have recently garnered significant levels of attention. Of ∼140 reports on the incorporation of these moieties into bridging ligands some 75% were published in the last 15 years. This review covers the synthesis of bridging ligands contg. di-2-pyridylamine and di-2-pyridylmethane chelating moieties, and a survey of their coordination and supramol. chem. Applications of the resulting systems as structural and functional models of enzyme active sites, and spin-crossover materials, and for studies into anion-π interactions are covered.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXmtVGgurs%253D&md5=000d4ffe7f75e6e4ae59fd4d055bd229

        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar

        Novel 2D and 3D Indium Metal-Organic Frameworks: Topology and Catalytic Properties
        Gomez-Lor, B.; Gutierrez-Puebla, E.; Iglesias, M.; Monge, M. A.; Ruiz-Valero, C.; Snejko, N.
        Chemistry of Materials (2005), 17 (10), 2568-2573CODEN: CMATEX; ISSN:0897-4756. (American Chemical Society)
        Four novel metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) [In(BDC)1.5(bipy)] (1), [In2(OH)2(BDC)2(phen)2] (2), [In(BTC)(H2O)(bipy)] (3), and [In(BTC)(H2O)(phen)] (4) (H2BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid, H3BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid) were synthesized and their structures were detd. by x-ray single-crystal diffraction. Structurally speaking while the metal/connector/chelate rate is 1:1:1, the introduction of a chelate ligand, such as bipy or phen, blocks the possibility of connections in one direction, inducting the formation of 2-dimensional structures. In the case of compd. 1, the extra 1/2 of BDC ligand per In favors the eight coordination of the metal and drives the formation of a catenated 3-dimensional structure. Topol. studies on the four compds. show one inclined catenation of hexagonal layers for 1 and three interdigitated layered structures with 2-dimensional topologies of type (44), (63), and (4.82) for 2, 3, and 4 compds., resp. Three of the new In compds. are active and selective acid catalyst in acetalization of aldehydes.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXjt1Smtro%253D&md5=dbb737e3639c49c33015dfe07f93d681

        Berl, V.; Schmutz, M.; Krische, M.-J.; Khoury, R.-G.; Lehn, J.-M. Chem.—Eur. J. 2002, 8, 1227– 1244
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        72
        Supramolecular polymers generated from heterocomplementary monomers linked through multiple hydrogen-bonding arrays-formation, characterization, and properties
        Berl, Volker; Schmutz, Marc; Krische, Michael J.; Khoury, Richard G.; Lehn, Jean-Marie
        Chemistry - A European Journal (2002), 8 (5), 1227-1244CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
        Supramol. polymers are described that are derived from the assocn. of two homoditopic heterocomplementary monomers through sextuple hydrogen-bonding arrays. They form fibers and a variety of different materials depending on the conditions. The strong affinity of the DAD - DAD (D=donor, A=acceptor) hydrogen-bonding sites for double-faced cyanuric acid type wedges drives the supramol. polymeric assembly in apolar and chlorinated org. solvents. The marked influence of stoichiometry, as well as end-capping and crosslinking agents upon fiber formation is revealed in soln. and by electron microscopy (EM). The results further contribute to the development of a supramol. polymer chem. that comprises reversible polymers formed through recognition-controlled noncovalent connections between the mol. components. Such materials are, by nature, dynamic and present adaptive character in view of their ability to respond to external stimuli.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        Meng, X.-R.; Song, Y.-L.; Hou, H.-W.; Han, H.-Y.; Xiao, B.; Fan, Y.-T.; Zhu, Y. Inorg. Chem. 2004, 43, 3528– 3536
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        73
        Hydrothermal Syntheses, Crystal Structures, and Characteristics of a Series of Cd-btx Coordination Polymers (btx = 1,4-Bis(triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene)
        Meng, Xiangru; Song, Yinglin; Hou, Hongwei; Han, Huayun; Xiao, Bo; Fan, Yaoting; Zhu, Yu
        Inorganic Chemistry (2004), 43 (11), 3528-3536CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Four novel Cd-btx (btx = 1,4-bis(triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene) coordination polymers [Cd(btx)2(NO3)2]n (1), [Cd(btx)2Cl2]n (2), [Cd(btx)(SO4)(H2O)2]n (3), and [Cd(btx)(S2O7)(H2O)]n (4) were prepd. by hydrothermal reaction (140 or 180°) and characterized. Both 1 and 2 have two-dimensional rhombohedral grid structures, 3 possesses a two-dimensional rectangular grid structure, and 4 displays a three-dimensional framework, which is formed by btx bridging parallel layers. To the author's best knowledge, polymer 4 is the 1st Cd(II) polymer in which the Cd(II) ion is eight-coordinated in a hexagonal bipyramidal geometry. The authors studied the effects of temp. on the hydrothermal reaction system of btx and CdSO4 and found that different products can be obtained at different temps. Also, polymer 3 possesses a very strong 3rd-order NLO absorptive effect with an α2 value of 1.15 × 10-9 m W-1. Polymers 2-4 display strong fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp. The DTA and TGA results of the four polymers are in agreement with the crystal structures.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXjs1ensb4%253D&md5=a90b407d0ceb6e864b578aecb62fb143

        König, E. Magnetic Properties of Coordination and Organometallic Transition Metal Compounds; Springer: Berlin, 1966.

        Direct oxidative conversion of aldehydes and alcohols to 2-imidazolines and 2-oxazolines using molecular iodine
        Ishihara, Midori; Togo, Hideo
        Tetrahedron (2007), 63 (6), 1474-1480CODEN: TETRAB; ISSN:0040-4020. (Elsevier Ltd.)
        Aldehydes were converted to the corresponding 2-imidazolines, e.g., I, and 2-oxazolines, II, in good yields by the reaction with ethylenediamines and aminoethanol, resp., using mol. iodine and potassium carbonate.         Microwave-assisted cascade cycloaddition for C-N bond formation: an approach to the construction of 1,4,5,6-tetrahydropyrimidine and 2-imidazoline derivatives
        An, Shujuan; Yin, Bing; Liu, Ping; Li, Xiangnan; Li, Chen; Li, Jianli; Shi, Zhen
        Synthesis (2013), 45 (18), 2525-2532CODEN: SYNTBF; ISSN:0039-7881. (Georg Thieme Verlag)

      77. 77
        Sheldrick, G.-M. Acta Crystallogr., Sect. A 2008, 64, 112– 122
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        77
        A short history of SHELX
        Sheldrick, George M.
        Acta Crystallographica, Section A: Foundations of Crystallography (2008), 64 (1), 112-122CODEN: ACACEQ; ISSN:0108-7673. (International Union of Crystallography)
        An account is given of the development of the SHELX system of computer programs from SHELX-76 to the present day. In addn. to identifying useful innovations that have come into general use through their implementation in SHELX, a crit. anal. is presented of the less-successful features, missed opportunities and desirable improvements for future releases of the software. An attempt is made to understand how a program originally designed for photog. intensity data, punched cards and computers over 10000 times slower than an av. modern personal computer has managed to survive for so long. SHELXL is the most widely used program for small-mol. refinement and SHELXS and SHELXD are often employed for structure soln. despite the availability of objectively superior programs. SHELXL also finds a niche for the refinement of macromols. against high-resoln. or twinned data; SHELXPRO acts as an interface for macromol. applications. SHELXC, SHELXD and SHELXE are proving useful for the exptl. phasing of macromols., esp. because they are fast and robust and so are often employed in pipelines for high-throughput phasing. This paper could serve as a general literature citation when one or more of the open-source SHELX programs (and the Bruker AXS version SHELXTL) are employed in the course of a crystal-structure detn.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhsVGhurzO&md5=8f91f10be4a9df74b2a9dad522c71e6e
      78. 78
        Yang, L.; Powell, D.-R.; Houser, R.-P. Dalton Trans. 2007, 955– 964
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        78
        Structural variation in copper(I) complexes with pyridylmethylamide ligands: structural analysis with a new four-coordinate geometry index, τ4
        Yang, Lei; Powell, Douglas R.; Houser, Robert P.
        Dalton Transactions (2007), (9), 955-964CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Four Cu(I) complexes were synthesized with a family of pyridylmethylamide ligands, HLR [HLR = N-(2-pyridylmethyl)acetamide, R = null; 2,2-dimethyl-N-(2-pyridylmethyl)propionamide, R = Me3; 2,2,2-triphenyl-N-(2-pyridylmethyl)acetamide, R = Ph3]. Complexes 1-3 were synthesized from the resp. ligand and [Cu(CH3CN)4]PF6 in a 2 : 1 molar ratio: [Cu(HL)2]PF6 (1), [Cu2(HLMe3)4](PF6)2 (2), [Cu(HLPh3)2]PF6 (3). Complex 4, [Cu(HL)(CH3CN)(PPh3)]PF6, was synthesized from the reaction of HL with [Cu(CH3CN)4]PF6 and PPh3 in a 1 : 1 : 1 molar ratio. X-ray crystal structures reveal that complexes 1, 3 and 4 are mononuclear Cu(I) species, while complex 2 is a Cu(I) dimer. The copper ions are four-coordinate with geometries ranging from distorted tetrahedral to seesaw in 1, 2, and 4. Complexes 1 and 2 are very air sensitive and they display similar electrochem. properties. The coordination geometry of complex 3 is nearly linear, two-coordinate. Complex 3 is exceptionally stable with respect to oxidn. in the air, and its cyclic voltammetry shows no oxidn. wave at 0-1.5 V. The unusual inertness of complex 3 towards oxidn. is attributed to the protection from bulky tri-Ph substituent of the HLPh3 ligand. A new geometric parameter for four-coordinate compds., τ4, is proposed as an improved, simple metric for quant. evaluating the geometry of four-coordinate complexes and compds.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhvVSnt7c%253D&md5=5a73b3d95dba734294881e675cf781c4

        Addison, A.-W.; Rao, T.-N.; Reedijk, J.; Rijn, J.-V.; Verschoor, G.-C. J. Chem. Soc., Dalton Trans. 1984, 1349– 1356
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        80
        Synthesis, structure, and spectroscopic properties of copper(II) compounds containing nitrogen-sulfur donor ligands: the crystal and molecular structure of aqua[1,7-bis(N-methylbenzimidazol-2'-yl)-2,6-dithiaheptane]copper(II) perchlorate
        Addison, Anthony W.; Rao, T. Nageswara; Reedijk, Jan; Van Rijn, Jacobus; Verschoor, Gerrit C.
        Journal of the Chemical Society, Dalton Transactions: Inorganic Chemistry (1972-1999) (1984), (7), 1349-56CODEN: JCDTBI; ISSN:0300-9246.
        The complexes [CuL(OH2)][ClO4]2 (I) and CuL(ClO4)2.2H2O (II) of the linear quadridentate N2S2 donor ligand III (L) were prepd.; they are significantly more stable towards autoredn. than the nonmethyl analogs. The structure of I was detd. by x-ray crystallog.; results were refined to an R of 0.047 for 3343 reflections. The Cu coordination is intermediate between trigonal bipyramidal and square pyramidal. In the solid state the coordination sphere in II may be a topoisomer of I. A new angular structural parameter, τ, is defined as an index of trigonality, a general descriptor of 5-coordinate centric mols. By this criterion the coordination of I in the solid state is described as 48% along the path of distortion from square pyramidal to trigonal bipyramidal. The S → Cu charge-transfer bands in the electronic spectrum of I are assigned. ESR and ligand field spectra show that the Cu compds. adopt a tetragonal structure in donor solvents.

        Comparative crystallography. Part 3. Crystal structures, electronic properties and structural pathways of four [Cu(phen)2Cl][Y] complexes (phen = 1,10-phenanthroline; Y = BF4-.0.5H2O, PF6-, CF3SO3-.H2O or BPh4-)
        Murphy, Gillian; Nagle, Pat; Murphy, Brian; Hathaway, Brian
        Journal of the Chemical Society, Dalton Transactions: Inorganic Chemistry (1997), (15), 2645-2652CODEN: JCDTBI; ISSN:0300-9246. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        The complexes [Cu(phen)2Cl][BF4]·0.5H2O (1, phen = 1,10-phenanthroline), [Cu(phen)2Cl][PF6] (2), [Cu(phen)2Cl][CF3SO3]·H2O (3) and [Cu(phen)2Cl][BPh4] (4) were prepd. and their structures detd. by x-ray crystallog. (1 and 2: monoclinic, space group P21/c; 3 and 4: triclinic, space group P‾1). Three of the complexes, 1-3, involve a CuN4Cl chromophore with a square based pyramidal distorted trigonal bipyramidal stereochem., while 4 involves a trigonal bipyramidal distorted square based pyramidal stereochem. The geometries of the CuN4Cl chromophores in 1-4 were compared by scatter-plot anal. with those of four other [Cu(phen)2Cl][Y] of known structure. The scatter plots of the eight cation distortion isomers of the [Cu(phen)2Cl][Y] complex suggest that all the complexes involve a -A +B route distortion of the CuN4Cl chromophore, -A (∼60%) and +B (∼40%). The observation of linear and parallel correlations are alternatively interpreted as a direct observation of vibronic coupling of a mixt. of the sym., νsym, C2 mode and the asym., νasym, non-C2 mode of vibration of the CuN4Cl chromophore. This emphasizes the need to det. the structure of the more than one complex in cation distortion isomers, in which the limits of the range of stereochemistries are indicated by the measurement of the electronic reflectance spectra.

        Assembly of Iron(II)-Triazole Polymers from 1D Chains to 3D Interpenetrated Frameworks: Syntheses, Structures, and Magnetic Properties
        Gu, Zhi-Guo; Xu, Yi-Fan; Zhou, Xin-Hui; Zuo, Jing-Lin; You, Xiao-Zeng
        Crystal Growth & Design (2008), 8 (4), 1306-1312CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        By the reactions of FeX2 with α,ω-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)alkane ligands (X = ClO4-, BF4-, NCS-, and NCSe-), novel Fe(II) coordination polymers were synthesized and characterized. [Fe(btp)3](ClO4)2 (1a), [Fe(btp)3](BF4)2 (1b), and [Fe(btp)2(NCS)2] (2) (btp = 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane) are infinite 1-dimensional-linear chains. [Fe(btb)3](ClO4)2 (3a) and [Fe(btb)3](BF4)2 (3b) (btb = 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane) are 3-fold interpenetrated α-Po cubic frameworks. The two sorts of btb ligands with different conformations alternately link to the Fe(II) centers in [Fe(btb)2(NCS)2]·H2O (4) to form a 3-dimensional interpenetrating architecture of CdSO4-like topol. When NCSe- instead of NCS- was used as the framework-regulator, a 2-dimensional grid layer [Fe(btb)2(NCSe)2]·2H2O (5) was obtained. The counteranions, spacer length, and conformation of the α,ω-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)alkane ligands are responsible for the assembled topol. architectures. Magnetic studies indicate that all of these Fe(II) polymers retain a high-spin ground state upon cooling from 300 to 4 K.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXislels74%253D&md5=e55027ca38bd28b6b236075403b9cae8

        Wang, X.-L.; Qin, C.; Wang, E.-B.; Su, Z.-M. Chem.—Eur. J. 2006, 12, 2680– 2691
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        83
        Metal nuclearity modulated four-, six-, and eight-connected entangled frameworks based on mono-, bi-, and trimetallic cores as nodes
        Wang, Xin-Long; Qin, Chao; Wang, En-Bo; Su, Zhong-Min
        Chemistry--A European Journal (2006), 12 (10), 2680-2691CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        To study the relation between network connectivity and metal nuclearity, the authors designed and synthesized three-dimensional (3D) entangled coordination frameworks based on different metal cores, [Zn2(bdc)2(L)2]·2H2O (1), [Zn(bdc)(L)0.5] (2), [Zn(oba)(L)0.5] (3) and [Cd3(bdc)3(L)2(H2O)2] (4) by self-assembly of d10 metal salts with the flexible long-chain ligand 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)butane (L), and with the rigid and nonrigid arom. dicarboxylate ligands 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate (bdc) and 4,4'-oxybis(benzoate) (oba). Compd. 1 exhibits a 3-fold interpenetrated diamondoid array typically based on a tetrahedral 2nd building unit (SBU) at a single Zn center. Compd. 2 adopts a 3-fold interpenetrated α-Po-type network that is built from bimetallic cores as six-connected vertexes. The structure of 3 also consists of dinuclear units comprising a novel (3,4)-connected 3-fold interpenetrated net with complex (4.6 × 10)-(4.62 × 103) topol. when single Zn centers act as four-connected nodes (or the α-Po topol. if dinuclear units are considered as six-connected nodes). 4, Derived from a cross-linked 5-fold interpenetrated diamond-like substructure, is an unusual example of a self-penetrating coordination framework displaying an unprecedented eight-connected 42068 topol. with trinuclear Cd clusters as eight-connected nodes which, to the authors' knowledge, not only defines a new topol. for eight-connected coordination networks, but also represents the highest connected topol. presently known for self-penetrating systems. Detailed structural comparison of these complexes indicates that the increase in metal nuclearity induces the progressive increase in the connectivities of the ultimate nets: i.e., the metal nuclearity plays a significant role in tuning the connectivity of a specific network. The thermal and luminescent properties of these compds. are discussed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        Syntheses, Structures, and Magnetic Properties of Inorganic-Organic Hybrid Cobalt(II) Phosphites Containing Bifunctional Ligands
        Fan, Jian; Yee, Gordon T.; Wang, Guangbin; Hanson, Brian E.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (2), 599-608CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Seven new cobalt(II) phosphites, [Co(HPO3)(C14H14N4)(H2O)2]·2H2O (1), [Co(HPO3)(C22H18N4)]·H2O (2), [Co2(HPO3)2(C22H18N4)2H2O]·H2O (3), [Co2(HPO3)2(C12H10N4)1.5H2O]·1.5H2O (4), [Co(HPO3)(C14H14N4)0.5]·H2O (5), [Co(HPO3)(C18H16N4)0.5] (6), and [Co(HPO3)(C18H16N4)0.5] (7) were synthesized in the presence of 1,2-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L1), 1,4-bis(benzimidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L2), 1,3-bis(benzimidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L3), 1,4-bis(1-imidazolyl)benzene (L4), 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L5), 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)naphthalene (L6), and 1,5-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)naphthalene (L7), resp., and their structures were detd. by x-ray crystallog. Compd. 1 is a mol. compd. in which two cobalt(II) ions are held together by double μ-O linkages. The inorg. framework of compds. 2 and 3 are composed of vertex-shared CoO2N2/CoO3N2 and HPO3 polyhedra that form four rings; these are further linked by an org. ligand to generate 2-dimensional sheets. Compds. 4 and 5 both have 1-dimensional inorg. structures, with the bifunctional ligands connected to each side of the ladder by coordination bonds to give 2-dimensional hybrid sheets. A 3-dimensional organically pillared hybrid framework is obsd. in 6 and 7. In 6, the stacking of the interlayer pillars gives rise to a small hydrophobic channel that extends through the entire structure parallel to the sheets. The temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibility measurements of these compds. show weak interactions between the metal centers, mediated through the μ-O and/or O-P-O linkages.

        Three Unprecedented Entangled Metal-Organic Frameworks: Self-Penetration and Hydrothermal in Situ Ligand Formation
        Sun, Li-Xin; Qi, Yan; Che, Yun-Xia; Batten, Stuart R.; Zheng, Ji-Min
        Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (7), 2995-2998CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)

        Hydrogen bond induced change of geometry and crystallized form of copper(II) complexes: syntheses and crystal structure of complexes with Schiff-base ligands containing two imidazolyl groups
        Long, La-Sheng; Cai, Ji-Wen; Ren, Yan-Ping; Tong, Ye-Xiang; Chen, Xiao-Ming; Ji, Liang-Nian; Huang, Rong-Bin; Zheng, Lan-Sun
        Journal of the Chemical Society, Dalton Transactions (2001), (6), 845-849CODEN: JCSDAA; ISSN:1472-7773. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Cu(II) complexes with the Schiff base methylbis[3-(5-methylimidazol-4-ylmethyleneimino)propyl]amine (BDPA), [Cu(BDPA)][ClO4]2·H2O (1) and [Cu(BDPA)][PF6]2 (2), and with a deprotonated Schiff base ligand [H2BIPO = 1,3-bis(5-methylimidazol-4-ylmethyleneimino)propan-2-ol], {[Cu(HBIPO)]ClO4·H2O}n (3) and (4), were prepd. Single-crystal structures show that 1 adopts a distorted square-pyramidal geometry with the basal plane occupied by an imidazole N, two imines and one amino N atom and the apical position by another N atom from BDPA. 2 Adopts a distorted trigonal-bipyramidal geometry with two imidazole N atoms at axial positions. Both 3 and 4 adopt distorted square-pyramidal geometry with four N atoms from HBIPO in the basal plane and the apical position occupied by a deprotonated imidazole N atom from an adjacent [Cu(HBIPO)] unit, resulting in polynuclear complexes. The differences in geometry and crystn. pathway between 1 and 2, and 3 and 4, are discussed based on the crystal structures, indicating that H bonding to the basal plane imidazole group plays an important role both in the change of geometry and crystn. form of the Cu(II) complexes.

        A series of 2D coordination complexes constructed from a flexible bis(methylbenzimidazole) ligand and different dicarboxylates
        Liu, Lu; Liu, Yanhua; Han, Gang; Wu, Dongqing; Hou, Hongwei; Fan, Yaoting
        Inorganica Chimica Acta (2013), 403 (), 25-34CODEN: ICHAA3; ISSN:0020-1693. (Elsevier B.V.)
        Five coordination complexes [Cd(hbmb)(tbi)]n (1), [Cd(hbmb)(adi)]n (2), [Zn(hbmb)0.5(atda)]n (3), {[Zn2(hbmb)(suc)1.5(OH)]·2H2O}n (4), and {[Zn2(hbmb) (fum)1.5(OH)]·2H2O}n (5) (H2tbi = 5-tert-butylisophthalic acid, H2adi = adipic acid, H2atda = 1,3-adamantanediacetic acid, H2suc = succinic acid, H2fum = fumaric acid, hbmb = 1,1'-(1,6-hexanediyl)bis(2-methylbenzimidazole)) were hydrothermally synthesized and structurally characterized. Complex 1 is an undulated 2-dimensional (2D) structure with (63)2 topol., contg. left- and right-handed helical chains. Complex 2 possesses a puckered 2D network with 44·62 topologies symbol. Complex 3 exhibits a 2D (4,4) parallelogram network and also owns left- and right-handed helical chains. Complexes 4 and 5 display 2D rectangular grids and can be simplified as a four-connected 44·62 topol. network. Also, the photoluminescence properties and thermal stabilities of the five complexes were studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXovFCjsrY%253D&md5=e67b11c212c4ec0a6c44adc38ac60eb1
      90. 90
        Rueff, J. M.; Masciocchi, N.; Rabu, P.; Sironi, A. Eur. J. Inorg. Chem. 2001, 2843– 2848
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        90
        Structure and magnetism of a polycrystalline transition metal soap - CoII[OOC(CH2)10COO](H2O)2
        Rueff, Jean-Michel; Masciocchi, Norberto; Rabu, Pierre; Sironi, Angelo; Skoulios, Antoine
        European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2001), (11), 2843-2848CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
        Diaquacobalt(II) n-dodecane-α,ω-dioate (2) was synthesized by metathesis of the corresponding K soap 1 and was fully characterized by chem. and spectroscopic anal. The crystal structure of 2 was established by x-ray powder diffraction techniques combined with electron diffraction expts. It crystallizes in a monoclinic cell P21/a; a 9.6558(8), b 7.4793(6), c 19.8936(2) Å, β 95.648(9)°, V = 1429.7(3) Å3; Z = 2 and consists of stacked layers of Co(II) ions connected by carboxylato bridges, thus forming chains that extend along the α axis. These layers are sepd. by alkyl chains arranged quasi-perpendicularly to the polar sheets. Structure anal. reveals a rare anti-anti conformation of the Co-OCO-Co fragments, which probably is responsible for the weak antiferromagnetism of the CoII chains. The exchange coupling const. between the magnetic centers was estd. as J = -2.08 K.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38Xnt1amtbg%253D&md5=a158dd838e4d34bf2d2baaf59cd1f3e3
      91. 91
        Wang, X.-Y.; Sevov, S.-C. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 1037– 1043
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        91
        Synthesis, Structures, and Magnetic Properties of Metal-Coordination Polymers with Benzenepentacarboxylate Linkers
        Wang, Xin-Yi; Sevov, Slavi C.
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2008), 47 (3), 1037-1043CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Three hybrid org.-inorg. coordination polymers with benzenepentacarboxylate (BPCA) linkers, [Co3(C6H(COO)5)(OH)(H2O)3] (1-Co), [Zn3(C6H(COO)5)(OH)(H2O)3] (2-Zn), and [Co5(C6H(COO)5)2(H2O)12]·(H2O)12 (3-Co), were synthesized hydrothermally and were characterized structurally and magnetically. 1-Co and 2-Zn are isostructural [C2/c; Z = 8; 1-Co, a 19.5350(6), b 10.4494(4), and c 13.2353(5) Å, β 97.2768(8)°; 2-Zn, a 19.5418(9), b 10.3220(10), and c 13.4660(10) Å, β 98.455(10)°] with three-dimensional structures that contain [M6] secondary building units bridged by BPCA ligands. A different Co-based compd., 3-Co, forms at lower pH and lower reaction temp. Its structure [P21/c; Z = 2; a 12.6162(2), b 11.3768(2), and c 15.3401(3) Å, β 91.539(1)°] is a more loosely packed framework with free (noncoordinated) carboxylic groups pointing at H2O-filled cavities in the framework. The magnetic phase diagram of 1-Co established through detailed magnetic measurements shows a metamagnetic transition below TN = 3.8 K. The less-packed compd. 3-Co, however, remains paramagnetic >1.9 K. The three compds. are the 1st examples of coordination polymers with benzenepentacarboxylate linkers and fill the gap of coordination polymers involving benzenepolycarboxylate linkers C6H6-n(COOH)n, where n = 2-6.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhsVCrsLjI&md5=7734e6f2df47fb804c24884fa101ad1a
      92. 92
        Liang, L.-L; Ren, S.-B.; Wang, J.; Zhang, J.; Li, Y.-Z.; Du, H.-B.; You, X.-Z. CrystEngComm 2010, 12, 2669– 2671
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        92
        A 3-dimensional coordination polymer with a fluorite structure constructed from a semi-rigid tetrahedral ligand
        Liang, Li-Li; Ren, Shi-Bin; Wang, Jun; Zhang, Jun; Li, Yi-Zhi; Du, Hong-Bin; You, Xiao-Zeng
        CrystEngComm (2010), 12 (10), 2669-2671CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A new 3-dimensional coordination polymer [Co3(HL)2](DMF)8(H2O)13 (1) (H4L = tetrakis[4-(carboxyphenoxy)methyl]methane), was solvothermally synthesized, which possesses a fluorite network built from 8-connecting Co3 clusters and 4-connecting tetrahedral ligands, and exhibits ferromagnetic behavior between the CoII ions.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXht12jsbrF&md5=b71d573f856723983d31e0519e0f3a9a
      93. 93
        Carlin, R.-L. Magnetochemistry; Springer: Berlin, 1986.
        [Crossref], Google Scholar
        There is no corresponding record for this reference.
      94. 94
        Bleaney, B.; Bowers, K.-D. Proc. R. Soc. London 1952, 214, 451– 465
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        94
        Anomalous paramagnetism of copper acetate
        Bleaney, B.; Bowers, K. D.
        Proceedings of the Royal Society of London, Series A: Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Sciences (1952), 214 (), 451-65CODEN: PRLAAZ; ISSN:1364-5021.
        Paramagnetic resonance is studied on large single crystals of Cu acetate, the prepn. of which is described. The spectrum is anomalous. The anomalies in fine structure and hyperfine structure are accounted for by postulating strong interaction between isolated pairs of Cu ions, each pair forming a lower singlet and an upper triplet state, only the latter being paramagnetic. The unit cell contains 2 differently oriented pairs of ions. The structure corresponds to an effective spin of 1. The interaction forces are discussed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaG38XmsVCjsA%253D%253D&md5=3d87a4bf0fd5c298372436dcaa1c1108
